Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.vector

Enum Class EarthShape

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<EarthShape>
gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.vector.EarthShape
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<EarthShape>, Constable
public enum EarthShape extends Enum<EarthShape>

An Enumeration of Earth shapes including a spherical earth and a number of different ellipsoids.

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2007

Company: Sandia National Laboratories

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Enum

    Enum.EnumDesc<E extends Enum<E>>

  • Enum Constant Summary

    Enum Constants
    Enum Constant
    Description
    GRS80
    The Earth is assumed to be an ellipsoid whose shape is defined by the GRS80 ellipsoid specification.
    GRS80_RCONST
    A hybrid coordinate system where latitudes are converted between geodetic and geocentric values using the GRS80 ellipsoid, but conversions between depth and radius assume that the Earth has constant radius of 6371 km.
    IERS2003
    The Earth is assumed to be an ellipsoid whose shape is defined by the IERS ellipsoid specification.
    IERS2003_RCONST
    A hybrid coordinate system where latitudes are converted between geodetic and geocentric values using the IERS ellipsoid, but conversions between depth and radius assume that the Earth has constant radius of 6371 km.
    SPHERE
    The Earth is assumed to be a sphere of radius 6371 km.
    WGS84
    The Earth is assumed to be an ellipsoid whose shape is defined by the WGS84 ellipsoid specification.
    WGS84_RCONST
    A hybrid coordinate system where latitudes are converted between geodetic and geocentric values using the WGS84 ellipsoid, but conversions between depth and radius assume that the Earth has constant radius of 6371 km.

  • Enum Constant Details

    • SPHERE

      public static final EarthShape SPHERE
      The Earth is assumed to be a sphere of radius 6371 km.

    • GRS80

      public static final EarthShape GRS80
      The Earth is assumed to be an ellipsoid whose shape is defined by the GRS80 ellipsoid specification.

    • GRS80_RCONST

      public static final EarthShape GRS80_RCONST
      A hybrid coordinate system where latitudes are converted between geodetic and geocentric values using the GRS80 ellipsoid, but conversions between depth and radius assume that the Earth has constant radius of 6371 km.

    • WGS84

      public static final EarthShape WGS84
      The Earth is assumed to be an ellipsoid whose shape is defined by the WGS84 ellipsoid specification.

    • WGS84_RCONST

      public static final EarthShape WGS84_RCONST
      A hybrid coordinate system where latitudes are converted between geodetic and geocentric values using the WGS84 ellipsoid, but conversions between depth and radius assume that the Earth has constant radius of 6371 km.

    • IERS2003

      public static final EarthShape IERS2003
      The Earth is assumed to be an ellipsoid whose shape is defined by the IERS ellipsoid specification.

    • IERS2003_RCONST

      public static final EarthShape IERS2003_RCONST
      A hybrid coordinate system where latitudes are converted between geodetic and geocentric values using the IERS ellipsoid, but conversions between depth and radius assume that the Earth has constant radius of 6371 km.

  • Field Details

    • approximateLatitudes

      public static boolean approximateLatitudes
      If true, then an approximate algorithm will be used to convert back and forth between geocentric and geographic latitudes. The approximation incurs an error of about 0.1 meters in latitude calculations but is much faster than the correct calculation.

      Note that the existence of this static, mutable variable technically violates thread-safety of this class. But given the assumption that the approximation is just as good as the true conversions, this is not a significant violation.

    • constantRadius

      public final boolean constantRadius
      True for EarthShapes that assume that the Earth has constant radius for purposes of converting between radius and depth.

    • equatorialRadius

      public final double equatorialRadius
      The radius of the earth at the equator.

    • flattening

      public final double flattening
      flattening equals [ 1 - b/a ] where a is equatorial radius and b is the polar radius

    • inverseFlattening

      public final double inverseFlattening
      [ 1./flattening ]

    • eccentricitySqr

      public final double eccentricitySqr
      Eccentricity squared.

      Equals [ flattening * (2. - flattening) ]

      Also equals [ 1 - sqr(b)/sqr(a) ] where a is the equatorial radius and b is the polar radius.

    • e1

      public final double e1
      Equals [ 1 - eccentricitySqr ]

    • e2

      public final double e2
      Equals [ eccentricitySqr / (1 - eccentricitySqr) ]

      v - double[]
      Returns:

    • getEllipse

      public double[][] getEllipse​(double latCenter, double lonCenter, double majax, double minax, double trend, int npoints, boolean inDegrees)
      Compute points that define an ellipse centered at a specified point.
      Parameters:
      latCenter - latitude of center of ellipse
      lonCenter - longiitude of center of ellipse
      majax - the length of the major axis of the ellipse, in km.
      minax - the length of the minor axis of the ellipse, in km.
      trend - the orientation relative to north of the major axis of the ellipse.
      npoints - the number of points to define the ellipse
      inDegrees - if true, centerLat, centerLon, trend and all return values have units of degrees, otherwise, the units are radians.
      Returns:
      an array with dimensions npoints x 2 containing the latitude and longitude of points that define the ellipse.

    • getGeographicLat

      Convert geocentricLat in radians to geographicLat in radians.

      Returns:
